= Preliminary results North Sea fog case=
Some results from 3D experiments for the North Sea fog case related to the cloud, convection and turbulence scheme. Wim de Rooy[[BR]]
[https://hirlam.org/trac/attachment/wiki/HarmonieWorkingWeek/Clouds201210/North_Sea_Fog_2.ppt][[BR]]
[[BR]]
New results showing diagnostics of the North sea fog case reference run as well as experiments with modifications in the turbulence scheme.
The development and persistence of fog turns out to be very sensitive to the turbulent length scale. Arguments are given to experiment with an[[BR]]
alternative length scale (according to Lenderink & Holtslag 2004) as applied in Hirlam and RACMO (a regional climate model).[[BR]]
https://hirlam.org/trac/attachment/wiki/HarmonieWorkingWeek/Clouds201210/North_Sea_Fog_3.ppt
[[BR]]
Sensitivity to Semi-Lagrangian Horizontal Diffusion. The fog field show little or no sensitivity to quite radical changes in horizontal diffusion settings, Lisa Bengtsson.[[BR]]
https://hirlam.org/trac/attachment/wiki/HarmonieWorkingWeek/Clouds201210/FOG_north_sea.odp
[[BR]]
Experiment with SST + 1 Celsius as well as difference between warm and cold start. Wim de Rooy[[BR]]

= Test by Karl-Ivar =
"Did a test with a small modification of the vertical diffusion scheme in AROME as discussed during the meeting last autumn. The aim is to test if a modification similar to thatin Hirlam's vertical diffusion scheme CBR, works also for the scheme in AROME. It is is just to increase mixing at a top of a cloud, where the unmodified parameterization assumes that it is conciderable more static  stable than if the cloud where absent.  The effect of the change is not large, but a small  improvement for clouds and precipitation in summer is seen. No improvement in winter." [[BR]]
https://hirlam.org/trac/attachment/wiki/HarmonieWorkingWeek/Clouds201210/mod_vdiff.pdf [[BR]]

Impact of the above described modification on the North Sea case of 20120322, Lisa Bengtsson [[BR]]
https://hirlam.org/trac/attachment/wiki/HarmonieWorkingWeek/Clouds201210/northsea_vertdiff.pdf[[BR]]

= '''Plans and Suggestions''' =

ASW 2014 working group report [http://www.cnrm.meteo.fr/aladin/IMG/pdf/physics_meeting_asm2014.pdf link to ASW site][[BR]]

''SMHI (Karl-Ivar)''[[BR]]
-Continue work on arome cloudphysics  (changes similar to Hirlam 7.4)[[BR]]
-Strange behaviour in ice fogs seems related to mixing length. Continue work on alternative length scales is encouraged[[BR]]
[[BR]]
''KNMI concerning cloud/fog (turbulence) (Wim de Rooy)''
[[BR]]
-Thorough check of the implementation of RACMO TKE and lengthscales in Harmonie.[[BR]]
-Phasing new code in version 37h1.2 (ASTEX still runs with version 35)[[BR]]
-3D test to show that this implementation also improves the overpredicition of sea fog and does not deteriorate other model results. Apart from these 3D tests, the 1 year reforcasting of Harmonie must be used, running a version with this new implementation (providing long term in detail verification against Cabauw obseravtions and LES within the Testbed).
[[BR]]-Partly outside KNMI?:
The current implementation of the TKE length scale is far from "clean coded". If tests show the potential of this update, a cleaner code (with most likely a faster code)should be produced (possibly with help from other member(s) during working visit).[[BR]]
[[BR]]
''Meteo France (Yann Seity)''[[BR]]
-Concerning fog, in 2014, we plan to test the implementation in ICE3
microphysics of a 3D daily updated Nc (Number of cloud droplets) using
aerosols models outputs (MACC or MOCAGE)  instead of the current land/sea
fixed values.  It will be evaluated on sea fog cases.[[BR]]
-Increasing vertical resolution in physical parameterizations for
simulating fog (PHD work)[[BR]]
-In parallel, work for developing a 2 moments microphysics scheme for AROME
ill continue in Méso-NH, and the ICE4 scheme (hail) will be tested with
some modifications.[[BR]]
-Comparison EDMF/EDKF and their associated cloud schemes.[[BR]]
-Test cases, validation of the 1.3km L90 AROME-France version.[[BR]]
